data.title: 450 Popular English Boy and Girl Names With Meanings
data.meta_description: Delve into popular English names for boys and girls, each brimming with history and significance. From timeless classics to modern gems, find the perfect name that carries a rich tapestry of meaning.
data.text:
Picking the right name for your soon-to-arrive baby can be both exciting and challenging. A name identifies your child in a unique way and will be a part of your child for the rest of his or her life. When they are babies, they are unlikely to question you as to why you have named them something. However, as they get older, there will come a day when they will ask you why you gave them a particular name. It is not just about you but also about what vision you have for your boy or girl. Let’s check out some top and unique English names for boys and girls.

Cute English Baby Girl Names

Congratulations! You have just had a baby girl, and we couldn’t be more thrilled. It is only a matter of time before she steps out into the world and becomes an independent young woman. Below we have listed 225 English names that can help capture the essence of your child’s values and what you wish them to stand for.

1. Abigail

‘A father’s joy’. This name has become popular in the recent years and is often abbreviated as ‘Abby.’

2. Adah

From the Beautiful Scenery, Adornment, Ornament

3. Adia

Noble, Gift, Wealthy

4. Aisha

‘Alive’

5. Alexandra

‘Defender’ or ‘helper of men’. This is often shortened to Alex, which is also used as a nickname for similar names like Alexis and Alexa.

6. Alice

‘Noble’ or ‘Of nobility’ . Allie is a commonly-used nickname for Alice. Another version of this name is Allison.

7. Alis

Noble, Kind, Noble Sort

8. Alyssa

‘Rational’, ‘alyssum flower’ or ‘sanity’

9. Amber

‘Jewel’

10. Amelia

Striving/Industrious, ‘Defender’

11. Amelie

‘strive to work’ in French.

12. Amey

Beloved

13. Amy

‘Beloved’ in French. It is one of the popular British names for girls.

14. Anastasia

‘One who will be reborn’ or ‘resurrection’.

15. Angela

A modified version of Angelina. It means ‘Angel’.

16. Angelina

‘Angel’ or ‘messenger of God’.

17. Ani

Ornament, Beautiful, Variant of Anne / Ane

18. Anna

‘Grace’. Also used as a nickname for Annabelle

19. Annabelle

It means ‘favoured grace’ in French.

20. Anya

Inexhaustible, Gracious, Graceful

21. Ariel

‘Lion of God’. It is also spelt as Arielle.

22. Arya

‘Lioness, Noble’. It is frequently spelt as Aria.

23. Ash

Form of Ashley, Ash Tree Meadow

24. Ainslie

A gender-neutral name of Old English origin, Ainslie is a name that has a rustic charm of its own. It is originally derived from a place name Annesley and means ‘hermitage wood’ or ‘clearing.’

25. Audrey

Strength

26. Ava

‘Bird’ or ‘the living one’ or ‘life’. It may also be spelt as Eva.

27. Badra

Full Moon, Pretty, Goddess Durga

28. Beatrice

‘She who makes you happy’. It is also spelt Beatrix.

29. Belinda

‘Beautiful’. One of its other variants is ‘Bella’. ‘Bright linden tree’ or ‘bright serpent’.

30. Bella

‘Beautiful’. It is often used as a nickname for other names ending in –bella, like Annabella, Arabella, etc.

31. Bency

Right Hand of Jesus Christ, A Talkative Girl who is Very Scared

32. Berey

Exalted One, Bearer of Victory, True Image, To Help, Berry

33. Bery

True Image, Bearer of Victory, Berry, To Help, Exalted One

34. Bethany

Derived from the Bible, the name means ‘House of Figs’.

35. Bety

God is My Oath, God is Perfection

36. Bitsy

God is Perfection, God is My Oath

37. Brianna

‘Strong’

38. Brooke

‘Little stream’.

39. Cadie

Rhythm, A Rhythmic Flow of Sounds, Variant of Cady

40. Cady

Simple Happiness, Hillock, A Rhythmic Flow of Sounds, Pure

41. Caitlin

‘Pure’ or ‘unsullied’. Other versions of this name are Caty, Katie and Katelyn

42. Callie

‘Most beautiful’. It is often used as a diminutive of the names Callista (beautiful), and Calliope (beautiful voice).

43. Candy

Bright, Sweet, Glowing White

44. Cappi

Caprice, A Lively Piece, Whimsical

45. Carla

Fem Form of Carl, Womanly

46. Carny

Carnival Worker

47. Caroline

‘Strong’. It is the female version of Charles.

48. Catherine

‘Pure’ or ‘Clear’. Other versions of this name are Katherine and Katrina.

49. Cecilia

‘Blind’.

50. Ceila

Form of Cecilia

51. Charlotte

‘Free man’ or ‘petite’. Other versions of this name are Charlie, Carlotta, and Lottie

52. Chloe

‘Blooming’ or ‘young green shoot.

53. Christina

‘Follower of Christ’. Other variations of this name are Christine, Christiana, Kristina, and Kirsten.

54. Claire

‘Bright’ or ‘clear’.

55. Clara

‘Bright’ or ‘clear’. Another version of Claire.

56. Cora

‘Maiden’ in Greek. Other versions of this name are Corinna, Korinna and Kora.

57. Daisy

‘Day’s eye’ or ‘the daisy flower’

58. Dandy

God is My Judge

59. Daniella

‘God has judged’

60. Danya

God is My Judge, Feminine Variant of Daniel

61. Deborah

‘Bee’

62. Deena

Divine, God Like, Jacob’s Daughter, Judgement, Valley, Dinah, Spear Ruler, Silk

63. Delcy

‘Delight’ or ‘temptress’

65. Della

Graceful, Noble, Of Nobility, Small Winged One, Heart, Delight

66. Desha

Golden Girl

67. Dora

68. Dorothy

‘Gift of God ‘

69. Eddey

Friend of Riches, Blessed / Rich Friend

70. Edolie

Noble, Good Humour

71. Eleanor

‘Bright, shining one’

72. Elena

‘Shining’ or ‘Bright One’

73. Elina

Woman with Intelligence, Pure, Intelligent,

74. Elise

‘Oath of God’

75. Eliza

‘God is satisfaction’

76. Elizabeth

‘God is my oath’

77. Ella

‘Light’ or ‘beautiful fairy’. Other versions of this name are Elle and Ellen

78. Eloise

‘Healthy’ and ‘wide’

79. Elyana

My God has Answered

80. Elysha

Consecrated to God, Variant of Elissa

81. Emery

‘Brave’ and ‘powerful’

82. Emily

‘Striving’ or ‘Industrious’

83. Emma

‘Whole’ or ‘universal’. It is also used as a nickname for Emmeline, Emily, Emilia, and Amelia.

84. Emmy

85. Erica

‘Hidden’ or ‘Star’

87. Ethlyn

Noble, Honourable

89. Evelyn

‘Hazelnut’

‘Wild boar meadow’

91. Faith

92. Fanny

94. Felicity

95. Fionna

Originating from the land of Ireland, Fionna is a classic name with a modern feel to it. If you are looking for a name that has some mystery attached to it, this name might be the perfect choice for you. By the way, Fionna means ‘blessed’ and ‘white.’

96. Fiona

‘White’ or ‘fair’

97. Freya

‘Lady’

98. Gabriella

‘Woman of God’ or ‘God is my strength’

99. Genevieve

‘Of the race of Women’ or ‘white wave’

100. Grace/Gracie

‘Kindness’, ‘mercy’ or ‘beauty’

101. Hadley

‘Heather field’

102. Hadly

103. Hailey

From the Hay Meadow, Hay Clearing, Hero, Hay Woods

104. Hanah

Full of Grace

105. Hannah

‘Favour’ or ‘grace’

106. Harmony

‘Concord’ or ‘concurrence’

107. Harper

‘One who plays the harp’

108. Hazel

‘Hazel tree’ or ‘hazelnut’

109. Heavin

Heaven

110. Helene

111. Hollie

It is a version of the name Holly and means ‘Holly tree’.

112. Holly

‘Clearing by the hollow’ or ‘holly tree’

113. Ida

‘The Industrious one’

114. Imogen

‘Maiden’

115. Iris

Based on the Iris flower. It is also the name of the ‘Goddess of the rainbow’.

116. Isabel

‘Pledged to God’.

117. Isabella

‘Devoted to God’ or someone who is pious

118. Isabelle

It is a version of the name Isabella and means ‘devoted to God’.

119. Isla

‘Island’

‘Faithful’

121. Jacey

122. Jade

‘Stone of the colic’

123. Jaena

Supplanter, Jay Bird, Feminine Variant of Jay

124. Jainy

Gift from God, Name from Lord Vishnu

125. Jalin

Holder of Heel, Yahweh May Protect, Supplanter

126. Jasmine

A flower which is white and has a sweet scent.

127. Jennifer

Someone who is exceptionally fair skinned.

128. Jessica

A person who has remarkable foresight

129. Jocelyn

‘Member of the Gauts tribe’

130. Jordyn

‘To flow down’ or ‘descend like a river’

131. Josephine

‘God shall grow’ or ‘Jehovah increases’

132. Jovita

‘Dedicated to Jove’

133. Joy

‘Great happiness’

134. Joyce

‘Cheerful’ or ‘merry’

135. Julia

‘Youth’ or ‘youthful’. Some of the other versions of this name are Juliana, Julianne, Guilia and Giulianna.

136. Katie

‘Pure’

137. Kaylee

‘One who is filled with purity’

138. Kimberly

‘From the wood of a royal forest’.

139. Kylie

‘Beautiful’

140. Lacey

‘Braid’

141. Lauren

‘Laurel’ or ‘bay tree’

142. Layla

‘Intoxicating’, ‘dark beauty’ or ‘night’. Another version of this name is Lyla.

143. Leah

‘Weary’ or’ tired’

144. Lexi

‘Man’s defender’

145. Lily

‘Lily flower’ or ‘Pure’. Some of the variants of this name include Liliana, Lillian

146. Lilly

It is a variation of the name Lily and means purity.

147. Linda

‘Beautiful’

148. Lola

“Sorrows’

149. Lottie

‘Little and womanly’

150. Lucinda

‘Illumination’

151. Lucy

‘Light’ or ‘born at dawn’. Also used as a nickname for Lucinda.

152. Luna

‘Moon’

153. Lydia

‘Beautiful one’ or ‘noble one’

154. Mae

‘Bitter’ or ‘pearl’

155. Mackenzie

‘Comely’

156. Madeline

‘Elevated’ or ‘Magnificent’

157. Madison

‘Son of Matthew’ or ‘Gift of God’

158. Maisie

‘Child of light’ or ‘pearl’

159. Margaret

‘Pearl’

160. Martha

‘Mistress’.

161. Maria

‘Sea of sorrow’ or ‘sea of bitterness’. Some sources give the definition as ‘rebellion’ or ‘wished-for child’. Other versions of this name are Miriam, Mary and Marie.

162. Maryam

“Rebellious’

163. Megan

‘Pearl’ or ‘capable’

164. Melanie

Someone who has dark or black skin.

165. Melody

‘Song’ or ‘to sing’

166. Mia

‘Mine’ or ‘wished-for child’

167. Mila/ Milly

168. Molly

‘Bitter’

Someone who is a defender and champion of the sea.

‘Sunrise’ or ‘Born’

173. Norah

‘Honour’

174. Olivia

‘Olive branch’

175. Pagi

Helper, Servant

176. Paige

‘Young servant’

177. Paisley

‘Basilica’ or ‘Church’

178. Pamela

‘All honey’ or ‘all sweetness’

179. Payton

‘Poega’s town’ or ‘fighting man’s estate’. It is also spelt as Peyton.

180. Phoebe

‘Bright one’

181. Piper

‘One who plays the pipes’

182. Poppy

Inspired by the poppy flower which are large and bright.

183. Priscilla

‘Ancient’ or ‘Classical’

184. Queenie

‘Queen’

185. Quinn

‘Wisdom’ or ‘Intelligence’

186. Rachel

‘Ewe’ or ‘Lamb’

187. Reagan

188. Reese

‘Fiery’

189. Riley

‘Wood clearing’

190. Robyn

‘Bright famous one’

191. Rose

‘Rose flower’

192. Rosie

‘Rose flower’

193. Rosemary

‘Dew of the sea’ or ‘bitter rose’

194. Roxanne

195. Ruby

‘Red’ or a type of precious stone.

196. Sadie

‘Princess’

197. Samantha

‘God heard’ or ‘Listener’

198. Sara

‘Princess’

199. Sarah

‘Princess’

200. Scarlett

‘Red’

201. Sienna

‘Orange-red’

202. Skylar

‘Eternal life’ or ‘Water giver’

203. Sofia

‘Wisdom’

204. Sophia/ Sophie

‘Wisdom’. Some of the other versions of this name are

Sophie and Sofia.

205. Stella

‘Star’. It is also used as a diminutive of Estelle.

206. Summer

‘Summer season’

207. Susan/ Suzanne

‘Lily’. Some of the other versions of this name are Susannah and Susie.

208. Sylvia

‘Of the forest’

209. Tabitha

‘Gazelle’ or ‘Beauty’

210. Taylor

‘Cutter of cloth’ or ‘clothed with salvation’

211. Teresa

‘To reap’ or ‘harvester’

212. Thea

‘Goddess’

213. Trinity

‘Holy triad’

214. Udeline

Defender

215. Unita

Oneness, Sisterly Unites

216. Valerie

‘Valiant’

217. Victoria

‘Triumphant’

218. Violet

‘Purple’ or ‘the violet flower’

219. Vivian

‘Alive’

220. Willow

‘Slender’

221. Winnie

‘Fair’ or ‘blessed’

222. Ximena

‘Listener’

223. Yvonne

‘Yew tree’

224. Zara

‘Radiance’

225. Zoe

‘Life’

Also Read: Cute Flower Names for Baby Boys and Girls

Eloquent English Baby Boy Names

Congrats! Now that you are the proud parent of a baby boy, it is time that you decided a name for your little one. While some of the names are overtly masculine, there are others which are gentle and yet others which are gender neutral. Based on how you wish your son to be seen by society (atleast by first impressions), we have compiled 225 names that can do justice to the naming conundrum.

1. Aaron

‘Exalted or ‘High mountain’

2. Abel

‘Breath’ or ‘breathing spirit’

3. Abraham

‘Father of many’

4. Adam

‘Red’ or ‘to make’. This is one of the popular British names for boys.

5. Aden

Attractive, Handsome

6. Adrian

‘A man from Hadria’

7. Alan

‘Handsome’ or ‘little rock’

8. Albert

‘Noble’ or ‘Bright’

9. Alex

‘Helper and defender of mankind’

10. Alexander

‘Defender of men’

11. Alfie

‘Wise’

12. Andi

Man, Warrior

13. Andrew

Someone who has exceptional man-like qualities.

14. Anthony

‘Very praiseworthy’ or ‘Flower’

15. Archie

‘Genuine’

16. Asher

‘Fortunate’ or ‘blessed’

17. Ashley/Ashton

‘Lives in the ash tree grove or ash tree town’. One of the unique aspects of Ashley is that it is a unisex name.

18. Austin

‘Majestic’ or ‘venerable’

19. Avery

‘Ruler of Elves’

20. Axel

‘The father is peace’

21. Ayden/ Aidan

‘Little fire’

22. Barret

Brave as a Bear, Variant of Barnett, Bear-strength

23. Bart

Rich in Land, From the Barley Farm

24. Beau

‘Beautiful’ or ‘handsome’

25. Benjamin

‘Son of my right hand’

26. Bennett

‘Blessed’

27. Berli

Meadow with the Cow Barn

28. Binky

Field of Beans

29. Blake

This is one which is may seem contradictory as it can mean ‘dark complexioned’ but it can also mean ‘pale’ or ‘bright’.

30. Bobby

Bright Fame, Abbreviation of Robert, Short Form of Robert

31. Brad/ Bradley

‘Broad clearing’ and ‘broad wood’

32. Brandon

33. Bravo

An Excellent Man

34. Brody

‘Rampart’ or ‘muddy place’

35. Bron

36. Bruce

‘A thick brush’

37. Bryan

Honourable, Form of Brian

38. Bryce

Someone who is very fast and quick.

39. Bucky

Male Deer, Diminutive of Buck

40. Caleb

‘Dog’ or ‘A faithful person’

41. Calvin

‘Bald’

42. Camden

‘From the winding valley’

43. Cameron

‘Crooked nose’ or ‘crooked river’

44. Carlo

Strong, Masculine, A Free Man

45. Carlos

‘Full-grown’ or ‘man’

46. Carter

‘One who transports goods’

47. Casey

Alert, Watchful, Vigilant, Wakeful

48. Cayle

Bold

‘Full-grown’, ‘man’ or ‘free man’

50. Christian

‘Follower of Christ’

‘Carrier of Christ’

59. Cyan

‘One who subdues or tames’

62. Daniel

‘God is my judge’

63. Danny

Ruler of the People

‘Powerful’

‘Constant’ or Strong’

‘Brave as a wild boar’

‘Helper’

Grower of Beans, The Sky

Horseman, Perspicacity

Powerful Traveller, Mighty Voyager

91. Favian

Understanding, Derived from the Roman Clan Name Fabius

Fortunate, Happy, Name of a Saint

93. Felman

A Small Singing Bird, Breeder / Seller of Finches

95. Finley

‘Fair-haired warrior’. Finn is a commonly used nickname for Finley.

96. Fitz

Male Descendant, Son

97. Floyd

White Haired, The Hollow

‘Free man’

99. Fraze

French Town, Diminutive of Fraser

100. Frederick

‘Peaceful ruler’

101. Gabriel

‘God is my strength’ or ‘devoted to God’

102. Gavin

‘White hawk’

103. George

‘Tiller of soil’ or ‘farmer’

104. Giovanni

‘God has shown favour’

105. Graham

‘Gravelly homestead’

106. Grant

‘Someone who is destined to become great’

107. Grayson

‘Son of a steward’

108. Hagan

Strong Defence, Sanctuary, Safe Harbour

109. Hamil

Carrier, Bearer

110. Hardy

Strong, Bold, Brave, Daring

111. Harrison

‘Son of Harry’

112. Hayden

‘Heathen’ and ‘Fire’

113. Healy

From the Slope Land

114. Hector

‘Holding fast’ or ‘to restrain’ in Greek. This is one of the uncommon British boy names.

115. Henry

‘Ruler of an enclosure’

116. Hudson

‘Heart’ or ‘spirit’

117. Hunter

‘A person who hunts’

‘Gift from God’

119. Isaac

‘He who laughs’ or ‘laughter’

God is Gracious, Undefeatable

‘Gift from God’

‘Someone who is in good health’ or ‘God is gracious’

‘Son of Jack’ or ‘God has shown favour’

‘Supplanter’ or ‘ruler of tribes’

‘One who follows’

126. Jared

‘Rose’ or ‘Descending’

127. Jason

‘A healing’

128. Jasper

‘Treasure bringer’ or ‘An individual who keeps close watch over the wealth of others’.

129. Jayden

‘Thankful’

‘Jehovah is gracious’

‘Sons of Jens’

132. Jeremiah/ Jeremy

‘Exalted of the lord’ or ‘God will uplift’

133. Jesse

‘Wealthy’

134. Jesus

‘Jehovah is generous’

‘Jehovah is God’

‘God will give’

‘Jehovah has shown favour’

138. Jonah

‘Dove’

‘May God increase’

‘God will add’

141. Joshua

‘Jehovah is generous’

142. Jude

‘Praised’

143. Julian

‘Youthful’

144. Justin

‘Righteous’

145. Kabir

The Great, Powerful, Leader

147. Kai

‘Keeper of the keys’ or ‘Earth’

148. Kaiden/ Kayden

‘Son of Cadan’ in Gaelic and ‘companion’

‘Someone who is eternally handsome’

‘King’s field’

152. Kirk

Dweller by the Church, Church

153. Kody

Cushion, Helper, Descendant of the Helpful One

154. Landon

‘Long hill’ or ‘ridge’

Lion

‘Bold as a lion’

157. Levi

‘Pledged’ or ‘joined’

158. Liam

‘Helment of will’

‘Lake settlement’

‘Hollow’

161. Lorenzo

‘From Laurentium’

‘Bringer of light’

‘Light’

‘Light-giving’

166. Maddox

‘Son of Madoc’

167. Malachi

‘My messenger’

168. Marcus

‘Hammer’

‘War-like’

170. Mason

‘Stone worker’

171. Matthew

‘Gift of God’. Another form of this name is Matteo.

172. Maverick

‘Independent-minded’ or ‘unorthodox’. It is usually given to those individuals who are pioneers and exceptional in their field. For example, a maverick marksman is one who is good at shooting and has a unique style.

173. Maximus/ Maxwell

‘Greatest’

175. Melvin

‘Chief’ or ‘council protector’

180. Nicholas

Primrose, Flower

192. Reuben

‘Behold, a son’

193. Radella

With a royal oomph, Radellla has a separate fanbase among parents. This fantastic English baby name refers to ‘Elfin counsellor.’

194. Richard

‘Powerful ruler’

195. Robert

‘Famed’ or ‘Bright’

‘Citizen of Rome’

‘Ruler’

FAQs

1. How can you choose a perfect English baby name?

Choosing a perfect English baby name is a subjective process, but there are some common attributes that go into constructing an ideal English baby name, like family heritage, popularity, naming custom, cultural significance, and meanings. As per English naming custom, you must choose a name that involves three elements – a given name, a middle name, and a surname (family name). Since British people follow the patrilineal naming system, the father’s family name is added to the baby’s surname. But this is not a mandatory case. Many people prefer to go along with the mother’s family (last) name. Or if both families are influential or parents are looking forward to keep both family names, then they may use a surname with mother and father surnames in a hyphenated form.

In an English baby name, you will most probably also find that people have traditional Christian names taken from the Bible. A lot of people use Bible names for their rich meanings, which is another attribute reflecting the cultural significance.

2. Are English baby names suitable for all cultures?

English baby names may or may not be suitable for all individuals or families of all cultures, as different cultures have backgrounds and preferences. There are several different cultures, like Incan, Mayan, and Indian, that have unique naming traditions and preferences which may not suit well with English baby names. However, many people have started the modern and global approach of naming their babies so that if they travel, they don’t have any problem with their names. Moreover, English is used in various countries as a global language for trading and other things, making English names easy to pronounce and understand.

Finally, the suitability of a baby name in English for a particular culture depends on the individuals involved. Many names have transcended cultural boundaries, while others may be more closely tied to specific linguistic and cultural contexts. It’s advisable to approach the naming process with an open mind, cultural sensitivity, and a willingness to adapt or modify names to suit the preferences and traditions of the family.

3. What is the significance of middle names in English culture?

The concept of middle names started in the Middle Ages when Europeans couldn’t decide between giving their child a family name or a saint name as, at that time, many people were religious. So, they settled on naming their children with the given name first, the baptismal name in the middle, and the surname third. With the passing of time, people strayed away from middle names having baptismal or religious significance and started using the maiden name of the mother as the middle name.

Today, middle names may honour religion and godfathers, carry cultural or familial significance, or serve as a way to include a mother’s maiden name. They offer people a great degree of creativity and flexibility in expressing their identity while maintaining a link to tradition. Overall, middle names in English culture play a significant role in individualizing a person’s name, contributing to a sense of personal identity and connection to cultural roots.

While coming up with a name from this list can’t be an easy task, there are some factors that may make it easier for you apart from the meaning itself. Firstly, think about how the name might change because of the other kids in school. For example, Thomas might become Tom one day and may eventually morph into Tommy. The development of George into ‘George of the jungle’ is also a likely possibility. It is in times like these that reminding them of the beauty of their name will add value to their lives.

Secondly, the pronunciation of the name may become an issue for peers of your child. While the common names that are mentioned in this list such as Ryan or Ruby might be fine, a unique and exceptional name such as Zachary may face mutilation.

Lastly, there is a need to make a careful balance between a unique name and something that is common. While a unique name will make them stand out, a common name may give them a sense of mutual camaraderie with their peers.
